text: Lička Jesenica is a settlement in the Lika region of Croatia, in the municipality of Saborsko, Karlovac County. ==History== ==Culture== Orthodox church of St Elias in Lička Jesenica was built in 1751. The village feast celebrating St. Elias, the saint protector of the village, is traditionally held on August the 2nd. ==Demographics== According to the 2011 census, the settlement of Lička Jesenica has 100 inhabitants. This represents 22.52% of its pre-war population according to the 1991 census. The 1991 censusIzdanje Državnog zavoda za statistiku RH: Narodnosni sastav stanovništva RH od 1880-1991. godine. recorded that 98.42% of the village population were ethnic Serbs (437/444), 0.23% were ethic Croats (1/444) and 1.35% were of other ethnic origin (6/444). : ==Sights== * St. Elias Orthodox Church * Jasenica river * the old bridge over the Jasenica river, dating back to 1810 == Notable natives and residents== ==See also == * Saborsko massacre ==References== Category:Populated places in Karlovac County Category:Serb communities in Croatia
title: Lička Jesenica
